鍒字的基本解释

鍒
róu
软铁，即熟铁。

鍒字的汉语字典释义

[①]［róu］
［《廣韻》耳由切，平尤，日。］
亦作“鑐3”。
(1)熟铁。
(2)引申为柔。参见“鍒穎”。

鍒字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　鍒； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页1313第21
【唐韻】耳由切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】而由切，?音柔。【說文】鐵之耎也。　【集韻】或作鑐。

鍒字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
鍒字的起名意思

暂无。

Thorium
Basic explanation of words
Thorium
róu
Soft iron, that is, wrought iron.
Thorium
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［róu］
["Guangyun" Ear Youqie, Ping You, Day. ]
Also known as "鑐3".
(1) Wrought iron.
(2) The extension is soft. See "Thousand Ying".
Thorium
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Su Ji 1] [Golden Word Department] 　鍒; Kangxi Strokes: 17; Page Number: Page 1313 No. 21
[Tang Yun] The ear is cut by [Jiyun] [Yunhui] [Zhengyun] and by the cut, the sound is soft. [Said the text] The iron cypress also.　【Jiyun】or Zuoqi.
Thorium
